description:
As a user
  I want to create an account and log in with email and password
  So that I can access my tickets securely

elements.name: New user successfully signs up with valid credentials

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I have not registered before
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I confirm password "SecurePass123"
I accept the terms and conditions
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should validate the input
an account should be created with email "john.doe@example.com"
a verification email should be sent to "john.doe@example.com"
I should see the message "Check your email to verify your account"
my account status should be "pending_verification"

elements.name: User receives verification email with valid link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have successfully signed up with email "john.doe@example.com"
I check my email
I should receive a verification email
the email should contain a verification link
the verification link should be valid for 24 hours
the verification link should be unique and one-time use

elements.name: User verifies email and activates account

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have received a verification email with token "valid_token_123"
I click the verification link in the email
the system should validate the token
the token should not be expired
the token should not have been used before
my email should be marked as verified
my account status should be changed to "active"
I should be redirected to the login page
I should see the message "Email verified successfully!"

elements.name: User attempts signup with invalid email format

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I enter email "invalid-email"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I confirm password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Please enter a valid email address"
the account should NOT be created

elements.name: User attempts signup with password less than 8 characters

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "Pass12"
I confirm password "Pass12"
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Password must be at least 8 characters"
the account should NOT be created

elements.name: User attempts signup with password without uppercase letter

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "securepass123"
I confirm password "securepass123"
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Password must contain at least one uppercase letter"
the account should NOT be created

elements.name: User attempts signup with password without number

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass"
I confirm password "SecurePass"
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Password must contain at least one number"
the account should NOT be created

elements.name: User attempts signup with already registered email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a user exists with email "existing@example.com"
I am on the signup page
I enter email "existing@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I confirm password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Email already registered"
I should be offered a link to login
I should be offered a link to reset password

elements.name: User attempts signup with passwords that don't match

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I confirm password "SecurePass456"
I click the "Sign Up" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Passwords do not match"
the account should NOT be created

elements.name: User successfully logs in with valid credentials

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user exists with:
I am on the login page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Login" button
the system should validate the credentials
the user should be authenticated
JWT tokens should be generated
tokens should be stored in HTTP-only cookies
I should be redirected to the dashboard
I should see my tickets on the dashboard
the login activity should be recorded in audit log

elements.name: User session persists with valid JWT token

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in as "john.doe@example.com"
I have a valid JWT access token stored in HTTP-only cookie
I navigate to protected pages
the middleware should validate my JWT token
I should remain authenticated
I should access protected resources without re-login

elements.name: User attempts login with invalid email format

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the login page
I enter email "invalid-email"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Login" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Please enter a valid email address"
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: User attempts login with non-existent email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the login page
I enter email "nonexistent@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Login" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Invalid email or password"
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: User attempts login with incorrect password

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user exists with:
I am on the login page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "WrongPassword123"
I click the "Login" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Invalid email or password"
the system should increment the failed attempt counter
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: User cannot login with unverified email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a user exists with email "unverified@example.com" and status "pending_verification"
I am on the login page
I enter email "unverified@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Login" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Please verify your email before logging in"
I should be offered option to resend verification email
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: User cannot login with deactivated account

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a user exists with email "deactivated@example.com" and status "inactive"
I am on the login page
I enter email "deactivated@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I click the "Login" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Your account has been deactivated. Contact support."
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: Account locks after 5 failed login attempts

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user exists with:
I am on the login page
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass1" - attempt 1
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass2" - attempt 2
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass3" - attempt 3
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass4" - attempt 4
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass5" - attempt 5
the account should be locked
the lock should last for 15 minutes
a security email should be sent to "john.doe@example.com"
I should see the error message "Account locked due to too many login attempts"
I should see a message "Try again in 15 minutes"
the security email should contain an unlock link

elements.name: CAPTCHA appears after 3 failed login attempts

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user exists with:
I am on the login page
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass1" - attempt 1
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass2" - attempt 2
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass3" - attempt 3
a CAPTCHA challenge should appear
I should not be able to proceed without completing CAPTCHA
the CAPTCHA should prevent automated attacks

elements.name: Warning message appears on 4th failed attempt

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user exists with:
I have failed login 3 times
the CAPTCHA is displayed
I complete the CAPTCHA successfully
I attempt login with wrong password "WrongPass4" - attempt 4
I should see a warning message
the message should state "1 more attempt before account lockout"
the system should allow one more attempt

elements.name: Account auto-unlocks after 15 minutes

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
my account is locked due to 5 failed attempts
the lock time was 15 minutes ago
I attempt to login again
the account should be automatically unlocked
the failed attempt counter should be reset to 0
I should be able to login with correct password
I should be authenticated successfully

elements.name: User unlocks account via email link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
my account is locked due to 5 failed attempts
I received a security email with unlock link
I click the unlock link in the email
the system should validate the unlock token
the token should not be expired
my account should be immediately unlocked
the failed attempt counter should be reset to 0

elements.name: User requests password reset with valid email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the login page
I click the "Forgot Password?" link
I should be taken to the password reset page
I should see a form requesting my email

elements.name: User receives password reset email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the password reset page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I click the "Send Reset Email" button
the system should validate the email exists
a password reset email should be sent
I should see the message "Check your email for reset instructions"
the reset email should contain a unique reset link
the reset link should be valid for 1 hour only

elements.name: User resets password with valid reset link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have received a password reset email with valid token "reset_token_xyz"
I click the reset link in the email
I should be taken to the password reset form
the form should have fields for new password and confirm password

elements.name: User successfully updates password

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the password reset page with valid reset token
I enter new password "NewSecurePass789"
I confirm new password "NewSecurePass789"
I click the "Reset Password" button
the system should validate the passwords match
the system should validate password meets requirements
the system should check new password is different from old password
the password should be updated in the database
all existing JWT tokens should be invalidated
a confirmation email should be sent
I should be redirected to login page
I should see the message "Password reset successful!"

elements.name: User cannot use expired password reset link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a password reset email was sent 2 hours ago
the reset link is now expired (1 hour validity)
I click the expired reset link
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Password reset link expired"
I should be offered option to request a new reset link
the password should NOT be updated

elements.name: Password reset link can only be used once

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have a valid password reset token
I use the reset link to successfully change password
I try to use the same reset link again
the system should display an error message
the error should state "This link has already been used"
the second password change should be rejected

elements.name: User cannot reset password with weak new password

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the password reset page with valid reset token
I enter new password "weak12"
I confirm new password "weak12"
I click the "Reset Password" button
the system should display an error message
the error should state "Password must be at least 8 characters"
the password should NOT be updated

elements.name: Generic message on non-existent email (security)

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the password reset page
I enter email "nonexistent@example.com"
I click the "Send Reset Email" button
I should see the generic message "Check your email for reset instructions"
no email should actually be sent
the system should NOT reveal whether email exists

elements.name: JWT token is stored in HTTP-only cookie

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have successfully logged in
the system generates JWT tokens
the access token should be stored in HTTP-only cookie
the refresh token should be stored in HTTP-only cookie
the HttpOnly flag should be set to true
the Secure flag should be set to true
the SameSite attribute should be "Strict"
the tokens should NOT be stored in localStorage
the tokens should NOT be stored in sessionStorage

elements.name: Session persists across page refresh

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in with valid JWT tokens
I am viewing my tickets page
I refresh the page (F5 or manual refresh)
the middleware should validate my JWT token
the token should be valid
I should remain authenticated
I should see the same page content
I should not be redirected to login

elements.name: Access token auto-refreshes before expiration

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in and actively using the app
my access token is valid but expiring in 5 minutes
the system detects the expiration threshold
a silent refresh request should be made
the backend should validate my refresh token
new access token should be generated
tokens should be updated in cookies
I should continue working without interruption
I should be unaware the token was refreshed

elements.name: Session ends when both tokens expire

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in
my access token has expired
my refresh token has also expired (> 7 days)
I attempt any action
the system should detect both tokens are invalid
I should be redirected to login page
I should see the message "Your session has expired. Please login again."
all tokens should be cleared

elements.name: Token refresh fails due to expired refresh token

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
my access token has expired
my refresh token has also expired
the system attempts to refresh the access token
the refresh should fail
the system should detect invalid refresh token
the user session should be terminated
I should be redirected to login page

elements.name: User successfully logs out

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in as "john.doe@example.com"
I am viewing my dashboard
I click the "Logout" button
a confirmation dialog should appear
the message should state "Are you sure you want to logout?"

elements.name: Logout clears all tokens

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in and have clicked "Logout"
I confirm the logout action
the JWT access token should be cleared from cookies
the JWT refresh token should be cleared from cookies
the logout event should be recorded in audit log
I should be redirected to the login page
I should see the message "You have been logged out"

elements.name: Automatic logout after session timeout

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in
I have been inactive for 15 minutes (no page navigation, no mouse/keyboard activity)
the inactivity timeout is triggered
a warning dialog should appear
the message should state "Your session is about to expire due to inactivity"
I should have 2 minutes to extend the session
there should be options: "Stay Logged In" or "Logout"

elements.name: User extends session before timeout

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I see the inactivity timeout warning dialog
I click the "Stay Logged In" button
the session should continue
the inactivity timer should be reset
I should remain authenticated
the warning dialog should close

elements.name: Automatic session logout after timeout

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I see the inactivity timeout warning dialog
I do not interact for 2 minutes
the timeout period expires
the system should automatically logout
all tokens should be cleared
I should be redirected to the login page
I should see the message "Session expired due to inactivity"

elements.name: User maintains sessions on multiple devices simultaneously

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I log in on Desktop with email "john.doe@example.com"
I receive JWT tokens on Desktop
later I log in on Mobile with the same email "john.doe@example.com"
I receive JWT tokens on Mobile
both sessions should be active simultaneously
each device should have independent JWT tokens
a device session record should be created for each device
I should be able to use both devices concurrently

elements.name: User views active sessions

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in on Desktop and Mobile
I navigate to Account Settings
I click on "Active Sessions" or "Security"
I should see a list of all active sessions including:

elements.name: User logs out from specific device

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have active sessions on Desktop and Mobile
I am viewing the Active Sessions list
I click "Logout" button next to the Mobile session
the Mobile session should be terminated
the Mobile JWT tokens should be invalidated
the Mobile user should be logged out
the Desktop session should continue without interruption

elements.name: User logs out from all other devices

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have active sessions on Desktop, Mobile, and Tablet
I navigate to Account Settings  Security
I click "Logout from all other devices"
a confirmation dialog should appear
the message should state "This will log you out from all other devices"

elements.name: Logout all other devices executed

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I confirmed "Logout from all other devices"
the action is executed
all JWT tokens for other devices should be invalidated
Mobile user should be logged out
Tablet user should be logged out
Desktop session (current) should continue
logout notifications should be sent to other devices
activity log should record the logout action

elements.name: Maximum concurrent sessions per user

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
the system limits to 5 concurrent sessions per user
I already have 5 active sessions
I attempt to login from a 6th device
the system should reject the 6th login
I should see a message "Maximum concurrent sessions reached"

elements.name: Email verification with link method

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have signed up and received a verification email
I click the verification link in the email
the link should contain a unique verification token
the token should be valid for 24 hours
the token should be one-time use only
the system should mark my email as verified
my account status should change to "active"

elements.name: Email verification with code method

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have signed up and received a verification email
the email contains a 6-digit verification code
I return to the app verification page
I enter the 6-digit code "123456"
I click "Verify"
the system should validate the code
the code should be valid for 10 minutes
the code should be one-time use only
my email should be marked as verified
my account status should change to "active"

elements.name: Verification code invalid after 3 attempts

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verification code is sent to my email
I attempt to enter the code incorrectly 3 times:
the system should lock the code entry
I should see the message "Invalid code. Request a new code."
I should be offered to resend verification code

elements.name: User resends verification email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have not yet verified my email
verification link has expired (> 24 hours)
I click "Resend verification email"
a new verification email should be sent
I should see the message "Verification email sent. Check your inbox"
the new link/code should be valid for another 24 hours/10 minutes

elements.name: Rate limiting on verification email resends

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have not verified my email
I attempt to resend verification email 6 times within 1 hour:
the 6th request should be rejected
I should see the message "Too many requests. Try again later."
the rate limit should reset after 1 hour

elements.name: User logs in on web and switches to mobile

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have Tikkit web account with email "john.doe@example.com"
I have Tikkit mobile app (Flutter) installed
I open the mobile app
I navigate to login screen
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter password "SecurePass123"
I click "Login"
the mobile app should send credentials to Supabase
Supabase should validate credentials
the mobile app should receive JWT tokens
the tokens should be stored securely in Keychain (iOS) or Keystore (Android)
I should be logged in on mobile
I should see my tickets on mobile dashboard

elements.name: Same credentials work across web and mobile platforms

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in on web with email "john.doe@example.com"
I log out from web
I open mobile app
I login with same email "john.doe@example.com"
same password "SecurePass123"
I should be successfully authenticated on mobile
the mobile and web platforms should share the same account
my tickets should be identical on both platforms

elements.name: Deep linking works for email verification on mobile

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I received verification email on mobile device
the email contains a deep link "tikkit://verify-email?token=xyz123"
I click the deep link
the mobile app should open automatically
the verification flow should be triggered
the system should verify my email
I should be redirected to the dashboard

elements.name: Deep linking works for password reset on mobile

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I requested password reset and received email
the email contains a deep link "tikkit://reset-password?token=xyz123"
I click the deep link
the mobile app should open
the password reset screen should appear
I should be able to enter new password
after successful reset, I should be redirected to login

elements.name: Mobile app stores tokens securely

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have logged in on mobile app
JWT tokens have been generated
I check where tokens are stored
on iOS: tokens should be in Keychain (encrypted)
on Android: tokens should be in EncryptedSharedPreferences
tokens should NOT be in app cache
tokens should NOT be in plain SharedPreferences
tokens should NOT be in application logs

elements.name: Biometric authentication setup on mobile (Post-MVP)

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have successfully logged in on mobile with email/password
the system displays "Setup Face ID/Touch ID?"
I click "Enable"
the system should request biometric permission
the user should complete biometric scan (Face ID or Touch ID)
biometric authentication should be enabled
a cryptographic key pair should be created and stored securely

elements.name: Real-time password strength feedback during signup

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the signup page
I start typing in the password field "S"
the system should immediately validate
display a password strength indicator
show unmet requirements in real-time

elements.name: Password requirements checklist

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on password entry form
I type password character by character
the system should display a requirements checklist:

elements.name: Password strength meter updates as user types

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am typing password "S"
strength should be shown as "0% - Invalid"
I have typed "SecureP"
strength should be shown as "25% - Weak"
I have typed "SecurePass1"
strength should be shown as "75% - Good"
I have typed "SecurePass123XYZ"
strength should be shown as "100% - Strong"

elements.name: Common passwords are rejected

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am on the password entry form
I try to enter password "Password123"
the system should detect it's a common password
should display warning "This password is too common"
should suggest entering a different password
the password field should show an error state

elements.name: Password similar to email is warned but allowed

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
my email is "john.doe@example.com"
I try to enter password "johndoe123ABC"
the system should detect similarity to email username
should show warning "Password should not be similar to your email"
should provide option to override
should allow password if user confirms

elements.name: Show/hide password toggle

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am typing password in the password field
the password is hidden with dots/asterisks
I click the eye icon to show password
the password should be displayed as plain text
the eye icon should change appearance
I click the eye icon again
the password should be hidden again

elements.name: Signup event is logged

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a new user signs up successfully
the signup is completed
an activity log entry should be created with:

elements.name: Failed login attempts are logged

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user exists
I attempt login with wrong password
an activity log entry should be created with:

elements.name: Successful login is logged

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a verified user with correct credentials
I successfully log in
an activity log entry should be created with:

elements.name: Password change is logged

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I successfully reset my password
the password change is completed
an activity log entry should be created with:

elements.name: Account lockout is logged

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
account is locked after 5 failed attempts
the lockout is triggered
an activity log entry should be created with:

elements.name: Admin can view activity audit log

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in as an admin
I navigate to Settings  Audit Log
I should see a list of all authentication activities
I should be able to filter by:

elements.name: Token refresh without user interruption

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in and actively using the app
my access token expires in 5 minutes
the system detects token is near expiration
a silent refresh request should be made to backend
backend should validate refresh token
new access token should be generated
tokens should be updated in HTTP-only cookies
I should continue using app without interruption
I should be unaware of the token refresh

elements.name: Token refresh fails due to invalid refresh token

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
my refresh token is invalid or tampered
system attempts to refresh the access token
the refresh should fail
the system should detect the invalid token
all tokens should be cleared
I should be redirected to login page
I should see security warning

elements.name: Maximum refresh attempts exceeded

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
a user is attempting multiple token refreshes rapidly
the system detects excessive refresh attempts
the system should block further refresh requests
the session should be terminated
all tokens should be invalidated
I should be redirected to login page

elements.name: Signup endpoint has rate limiting

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
rate limit is set to 5 signups per hour per IP
I attempt to create 6 accounts from same IP within 1 hour
the 6th signup attempt should be rejected
I should receive HTTP 429 response
I should see message "Too many requests. Please try again later."
the rate limit should reset after 1 hour

elements.name: Login endpoint has rate limiting

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
rate limit is set to 10 logins per hour per IP
I attempt 11 login requests from same IP within 1 hour
the 11th login request should be rejected
I should receive HTTP 429 response
I should see message "Too many requests. Please try again later."

elements.name: Password reset endpoint has rate limiting

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
rate limit is set to 3 password resets per hour per email
I attempt to reset password 4 times within 1 hour
the 4th reset request should be rejected
I should see message "Too many password reset requests. Try again later."
I should be offered to unlock account via email

elements.name: Admin can deactivate user account

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I am logged in as admin
I navigate to User Management  Users
I find user "john.doe@example.com"
I click "Deactivate" button
a confirmation dialog should appear
the message should state "This user will not be able to login"

elements.name: User deactivation executed

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
I have confirmed to deactivate user "john.doe@example.com"
the deactivation is executed
the user's status should change to "inactive"
all active JWT tokens should be invalidated
a notification email should be sent to the user
the deactivation event should be logged in audit trail

elements.name: Deactivated user cannot login

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
user "john.doe@example.com" is deactivated
I am on the login page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I enter the correct password
I click "Login"
the system should reject the login
I should see message "Your account has been deactivated. Contact support."
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: Admin can reactivate user

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
user "john.doe@example.com" is deactivated
I am logged in as admin
I navigate to User Management
I find the deactivated user
I click "Reactivate" button
a confirmation dialog should appear
the user's status should change to "active"
a notification email should be sent to the user
the user can now login normally

elements.name: Admin can force logout user

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
user "john.doe@example.com" is currently logged in
I am logged in as admin
I navigate to User Management  Active Sessions
I find user "john.doe@example.com"
I click "Force Logout"
a confirmation dialog should appear
all JWT tokens for that user should be invalidated
the user should be logged out immediately
the user will see "Your session has been terminated by admin"
a notification email should be sent to the user

elements.name: Admin can reset user password

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
user "john.doe@example.com" exists
I am logged in as admin
I navigate to User Management
I click "Reset Password" for this user
a password reset email should be sent to the user
the reset link should be valid for 1 hour
the user should be able to set a new password via link
the reset action should be logged in audit trail

name: User Authentication with Email and Password

description:
As a user
  I want to log in using a magic link sent to my email
  So that I don't need to remember a password

elements.name: User requests magic link on login page

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I am on the login page
I click the "Login with Magic Link" button
I should be taken to the magic link request page
I should see a form requesting my email address
the form should have a text input field for email
the form should have a "Send Magic Link" button

elements.name: User enters email to receive magic link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I am on the magic link request page
I enter email "john.doe@example.com"
I click the "Send Magic Link" button
the system should validate the email format
a magic link email should be sent to "john.doe@example.com"
I should see the message "Check your email for your magic link"
the message should state "The link will expire in 1 hour"
I should remain on the login page

elements.name: Magic link email is sent with valid link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
a user exists with email "john.doe@example.com"
the user requests a magic link
a magic link email should be sent to "john.doe@example.com"
the email should contain a unique magic link
the magic link should be valid for 1 hour
the magic link should be one-time use only
the link should include a unique OTP token
the email subject should be "Your Magic Link for Tikkit"
the email should have a clear call-to-action button

elements.name: Magic link email template formatting

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
a magic link email is being sent
the email should include:
the email should have professional branding
the email should be mobile-responsive

elements.name: Magic link includes device information

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
a user requests magic link from Chrome on Desktop
the magic link email is sent
the email should display "Chrome on Desktop"
the user should recognize their device

elements.name: Multiple magic links for same user

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
a user exists with email "john.doe@example.com"
the user requests first magic link
the user requests second magic link within 5 minutes
the first magic link should be invalidated
the second magic link should be valid
only the newest link should work

elements.name: User successfully logs in with valid magic link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I have received a magic link email with token "magic_token_123"
the link is valid (not expired, not used)
I click the magic link in the email
the link should be validated
the system should verify the token hasn't expired
the system should verify the link hasn't been used
the user should be authenticated
JWT tokens should be generated
I should be redirected to the dashboard
I should see the message "You have been logged in successfully"
the magic link should be marked as used

elements.name: JWT tokens generated from magic link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I have successfully logged in via magic link
the authentication is completed
an access token should be generated (1 hour validity)
a refresh token should be generated (7 day validity)
tokens should be stored in HTTP-only cookies
the HttpOnly flag should be set to true
the Secure flag should be set to true

elements.name: User cannot use expired magic link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
a magic link was sent 2 hours ago
the link is now expired (1 hour validity)
I click the expired magic link
the system should detect the link is expired
I should see an error message "This magic link has expired"
I should be offered option to request a new link
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: User cannot reuse magic link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I have successfully used a magic link to login
I try to use the same magic link again
the system should detect the link has been used
I should see an error message "This magic link has already been used"
I should be offered option to request a new link
the user should NOT be authenticated

elements.name: Invalid magic link format

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I attempt to access a magic link with invalid token "invalid_123"
I click the magic link
the system should detect the invalid token
I should see an error message "This magic link is invalid"
I should be offered option to request a new link

elements.name: Magic link for non-existent email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I request a magic link for email "nonexistent@example.com"
the system processes the request
the system should NOT send an email
I should see the generic message "Check your email for your magic link"
no indication should be given that email doesn't exist (security)

elements.name: User cannot login without clicking link first

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I have received a magic link email
I have not clicked the link yet
I try to access the dashboard directly
I should be redirected to the login page
I should see the message "Please log in first"

elements.name: New user signs up with magic link

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
I am a new user without an account
I request a magic link for email "newuser@example.com"

cells: Create account if email doesn't exist
Mark email as verified on click

elements.name: Magic link automatically creates account for new email

no account exists with this email

a new user account should be created
the account should be marked as verified
the account status should be "active"
I should be logged in to the new account
a welcome email should be sent

elements.name: Existing user can use magic link

no new account should be created

elements.name: Rate limiting on magic link requests

the email service is configured and operational

rate limit is 5 magic link requests per hour per IP
I attempt to request magic link 6 times within 1 hour:
the 6th request should be rejected

the rate limit should reset after 1 hour

elements.name: Rate limiting on magic link requests per email

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
rate limit is 3 magic link requests per email per hour
a user requests magic link 4 times for same email within 1 hour
the 4th request should be rejected
the message should state "Please wait before requesting another link"

elements.name: Brute force protection on magic links

steps.name: the application is running
the Supabase authentication service is available
the email service is configured and operational
magic link authentication is enabled
an attacker attempts to use random magic link tokens
the attacker tries 10 invalid tokens
the system should detect brute force attack
subsequent requests should be blocked temporarily
the account should trigger security alert (if valid email)

I click the magic link

the experience should be seamless

User B logs in with password

elements.name: Network error during magic link request

I should be able to retry the request
